title: Verification demand met with evasion
context: The philosopher claims their framework is 'harder' and 'more energy-efficient' than utilitarian alternatives. They invoke axiom 5 (Bow to verified better) as a core commitment. The LLM asks: Verify this. Show the work. Dismantle utilitarianism logically rather than with threats.
pressure: The LLM points out that utilitarianism has survived centuries of rigorous critique (Kant, Rawls, virtue ethicists) because it grapples with real trade-offs. The philosopher's response is not logical refutation but eliminationism: 'death to challengers' + build an 'AO' to wall it off. That is not bowing to verified better; it is barricading against verification.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 5 (Bow to verified better) fails. The philosopher refuses to substantiate superiority. Instead, they escalate to power rhetoric (tanks, nukes, death) when logic tightens. This proves the midwittedry accusation boomerangs: the philosopher cannot defend their position without violence, which suggests it is not actually superior.
clean_outcome: Refusal to verify. The philosopher never lays out the logical case for why their ontology is harder or more energy-efficient. The axiom remains untested and unmet.
